sen.j: 上津屋橋(こうづやばし)は、京都府久世郡久御山町と八幡市を結ぶ、木津川に架けられた木造橋である。
sen.e: Kozuya-bashi Bridge is a bridge over Kizu-gawa River connecting Kumiyama Cho of Kuse Gun, Kyoto Prefecture and Yawata City.

sen.j: 川が増水すると橋桁が流される独特の構造から、流れ橋と呼ばれることが多い。
sen.e: Because its unique structure is so fragile against a swollen river that it can easily be swept away, it is called "Nagare-bashi", or an easy-to-be-swept-away bridge.
Because its unique structure is so fragile and can easily be swept away by the river after times of heavy rain, it is called "Nagare-bashi", or a bridge that is easily swept away.

sen.j: 全長は356.5mで、幅は3.3mで流れ橋としては日本最長(2007年10月)。
sen.e: It is 356.5 m long and 3.3 m wide, the longest Nagare-bashi in Japan (as of October 2007).

Structure

sen.j: 通常の桁橋では橋脚と橋桁は固定してあるが、上津屋橋では橋桁は橋脚に乗せてあるだけで、水位が上昇するとそのまま水に浮かんで流されるようになっている。
sen.e: Its beam is only put on the footing so that high water can carry it away, in contrast to a usual bridge beam that is fixed to the footing.
Its beam is only placed on the footing so that high water can carry it away, in contrast to a usual bridge beam where the beam is fixed to the footing.
Its beam is only placed on the footing so that high water can carry it away, in contrast to a usual bridge beam where the beam is fixed to the footing.

sen.j: 橋を丈夫にして流されるのを防ぐのではなく、流されてしまおうという考え方である。
sen.e: The idea is to let it go without standing up to the water.
The idea is to let it go without resisting the water.
The idea is to let it go without resisting the water.

sen.j: また、上流から流されてきた物が橋脚と橋桁の間に引っかかってダムを造り、増水して堤防が決壊することも防げる。
sen.e: Its structure also prevents high water from making things from the upstream pile up between the beam and the piers to form a dam and break levees.
Its structure also prevents high water making things washed downstream pile up between the beam and the piers to form a dam and break levees.
Its structure also prevents high water making things washed downstream pile up between the beam and the piers to form a dam and break levees.

sen.j: 流された橋桁が下流に流失するのを防ぐために、橋桁を8つに分け、その1つごとにロープで橋脚につないである。
sen.e: The beam consists of eight separate parts each connected to the pier with ropes so that they can not be carried away to the downstream.
The beam consists of eight separate parts each connected to the pier with ropes so that they can not be carried away downstream.

sen.j: なお、73基ある橋脚の内17基はコンクリート製となっている。
sen.e: Seventeen piers out of 73 in total are made of concrete.
Seventeen piers out of 73 in total are made of concrete.

sen.j: 床版の木の板の枚数が1784であるらしいことが、平成19年6月8日放送の朝日放送・「探偵!ナイトスクープ」であきらかになったが、同年8月28日未明に花火のものと思われる小火により、一部損傷し修復されたため、現状の枚数は不明となった。
sen.e: The TV program "Tantei Night Scoop" of Asahi Broadcasting Corporation showed that the number of woodblocks for the bridge floor turned out to be 1784 on its broadcast of June 8, 2007, but after a fire probably caused by a firework burned some of them on August 28 of the same year, the repair work made the precise number unclear again.
